Posts.Content: clcady wrote: I had a open biopsy done Thursday the 27th. The doctor told my husband that there where small cysts surronding my lump and this was a good sign. That we should have any thing to be concerned about. Does any one know what this means about the cysts? Dx 4/1/2008, IDC, <1cm, Stage I, Grade 1, 0/1 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Surgery 4/10/2008 Lumpectomy: Right Chemotherapy 4/20/2008 Cytoxan (cyclophosphamide), Taxotere (docetaxel) Radiation Therapy 9/2/2008 Breast, Lymph nodes Dx 5/15/2018, DCIS, Right, Stage 0, ER+/PR+ Surgery 7/17/2018 Lymph node removal; Mastectomy: Right; Prophylactic mastectomy: Left; Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Open Biopsy clcady TenderIsOurMight

Posts.Content: Apr 16, 2008 11:28AM clcady wrote: Um...I'm 34. I just had a lumpectomy last Thursday the 10th. I had an open biopsy prior to the lumpectomy. The surgeon said he had to do the same thing take a bit more tissue than was expected. I don't think a whole cup size though. I am waiting to see what it looks like. (Mine came back invasive cancer which is now gone I'm waiting for the tumor board to come back with what my treatments will be. For myself I didn't even want to look at the option of a mastectomy. Maybe because I am 34. I don't know. What I do know is that the suggestion for a mastectomy was never brought up. I hope that helps a little.
